title: (7600-095) Aljustrel - 13 Estrada de Aljustrel
description: Parking, quiet at night, 250 meters from the center with lots of shops. No services

title: (7600) Aljustrel - 31 Rua da Estalagem
description: Parking Intermarché Aljustrel, easy to access, there is all the necessary for logistical needs: food, fuel, washing machine and dryer, small cafeteria and gas bottles. No maintenance service, but access to the store's wifi with the code "intermarche" (without quotation marks!). The manager and his team are very attentive and particularly friendly. A practical stop!

title: (7600-033) Aljustrel - 46 Rua de Montes Velhos
description: Parking with more than 10 spaces. Quiet, next to a school but no one has bothered us. The cars from the main street can be heard a little but they do not bother.

title: (7600) Aljustrel - Rua Nossa Senhora do Castelo
title_short: (7600) Aljustrel - Rua Nossa Senhora do Castelo
description: Aljustrel panoramic view of Nossa Senhora do Castelo

title: (7600-077) Aljustrel - 55 N261
description: Gas station which is official retailer for Campingaz.

title: (7600) Aljustrel - N2
description:
Beautiful spot right next to the reservoir / lake, with a small picnic area served with wooden tables / benches around in some shade. Very peaceful & nice place to rest surrounded by nature. Lots of stars at night ☆ on the way along the famous N2 road 

Ervidel is a lovely small town nearby.

title: (7600) Ervidel -
description: Great place for a quiet day and night. No one on site. Accessible by 4x4 and small campervans. Not by big motorhomes. Great to do a bike ride. Stayed for one night. We saw noone.

title: (7600) Ervidel - 7600 Largo de Liberdade
description: Large park with grass and shade, some shaded parking. Perfect for a stop to rest, picnic ...

title: () Messejana - 6 Rua Nova de Palma
description: Private space. Wc, swimming pool, very clean and calm

name: Terra Nua - Naturist Camping Site
title: (7600) Terra Nua - Naturist Camping Site
description: Naturist camping - barrier-free/ wheelchair accessible. Very friendly and helpful owner, nice big area with pool and minibar. Lots of attention to detail, a variety of plants, sanitary facilities as new and clean. No light pollution, so an infinite starry sky. Very peaceful and quiet environment. Except for the sound of silence, only the bells of the sheep can be heard. The nearby village can be reached on foot through fields with olive trees. There is fresh bread from the baker, and he also comes to the campsite in the season. In addition to a small supermarket, there are also a few restaurants offering local dishes and drinks for little money. The large supermarkets in Aljustrel are also easily accessible by bike or car.

title: (7900) Ferreira do Alentejo - N2
description: Small nice parking lot with spring water. And super quiet. You hardly hear anything from the street, which is hardly used.

title: (7900) Ferreira do Alentejo - N2
description: On the N2, Ferreira do Alentejo. Parking of the sports complex. Quiet recommended by local residents. Near the center and shops. laundry in Intermarché. wc at the entrance of the public garden and games for children.

title: (7900-568) Ferreira do Alentejo - 4 Largo dos Bombeiros Voluntários
title_short: (7900-568) Ferreira do Alentejo - 4 Largo dos Bombeiros Voluntários
description:
Place with secure to pass the night. No services.

Firemans are nice people and let motorhomes pass the night there.

Public area near with playground but closes at night.

Restaurants and supermarkets available.

title: (7565) Mimosa - 2 Rua Liberdade do Povo
description: Water and empty place

title: (7900-252) Figueira dos Cavaleiros - 23 N259
description: A small parking area with a playground for kids. 3G or 4G available ?

title: (7565) Alvalade - 109 Avenida Cinco Outubro
description: Quiet street next to the college which also serves as a parking lot for buses. At the end of the path there is also a large vacant lot. Ok for overnight stay (tested in November). No service. Some shops, post office and gas station in the village. Washing machine in Mimosa the village following north section (Lisbon).

title: (7565) Alvalade - 15 Rua de São Pedro
description: Ground parking opposite the stadium and gardens. No service. Had a night in November (so no need for shade!). Calm.

title: (7780) Castro Verde - E802
description: Repsol gas station Park could spend night, free water. Free Park. Repsol station de gaz Park pourrait passer la nuit, l'eau libre. Parc gratuit.

title: (7780-346) Entradas - 41 Avenida Nossa Senhora da Esperança
title_short: (7780-346) Entradas - 41 Avenida Nossa Senhora da Esperança
description: Typical little village to see. Very quiet night. Water point at the washhouse 50 meters

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado - IC1
description: Drinking water from two wells, picnic area available, approx. 10 parking spaces.

title: (7780) Castro Verde - Unnamed Road
description:
At the exit of the village of Entradas, a superb picnic area brand new and well equipped with tables, benches, garbage cans and barbecues. Close to walking paths and a body of water.
Bird information board.
A few trees for shade.
Slightly sloping ground.
No prohibition for motorhomes visible.
Calm, quiet, possible to spend the night there.
Networks okay.

title: (7800) Beja - 43 Rua de Nossa Senhora
description: Very narrow road access, but plenty of space to park. With lighting, next to the pisão dam. Very nice Further, in another park, a much wider road alongside a bar, a playground and snacks and sports equipment. No service.

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado - 7565 N121
description:
Self-service laundry.
Parking in front of the vending machines.

title: (7800) Beja - Unnamed Road
description: The P2 allowed for motorhomes is 700m on foot along the lake to the beautiful beach "5 Réis"! There are showers on the beach! Photo 1 is allowed in front of the entrance to the electrical station,? Photo 4 is the permitted P2, Photo 5 board at P1

title: (7800) Beja - Unnamed Road
description: Fluvial beach inaugurated in 2020. Two parking areas, one next to the bar and other facilities and another a little further away among the olive trees. Quiet and spacious place to take a good bath. There is no shade because the trees are newly planted.

title: (7780) Castro Verde -
description: Magnificent spot lost in the middle of nature, view of the lake below. Dirt/sand road to get there.

title: (7800) Beja - Rua das Cavadas
description:
Nice spot in a little town with a lot of places to walk where you will discover nice fountains. Close to the coffes, markets and bakery. With a small playgrounds for Kids.
Ask about fonte das cavadas and ribeiro anda people will explains us how to go there, you can get free water from that 2 fountains.

title: (7780) Castro Verde -
description: Fantastic place in the middle of nature on a lake. It is completely silent here at night as well as during the day. 4x4 is not necessary.

title: (7670) Barragem do Monte da Rocha - N261-4
title_short: (7670) Barragem do Monte da Rocha - N261-4
description: Parking overlooking the reservoir with a beautiful panorama. Very easy access for all types of vehicles. No service but 500 meters from a small bar / restaurant with wifi. Be careful, however, of the sound of the turbine, which can disturb the most sensitive gills during the night!

title: (7800) Penedo Gordo - Rua das Cavadas
description: Peaceful place with fountain, tables and a small little river and good shadow and a beautiful roman aquedute.

title: (7670) - Unnamed Road
description: Nice little place in the middle of the green oaks.  With the lake around.  Super cool, duck, partridge, dragonfly, etc. Naturist possibility.  4x4 or van only.  Accessible trail.  Many other places to get well.  No service

title: () Ourique - 128 Rua da Sardoa
description: Parking dans un site pittoresque du barrage d'Albufeira, restaurant à proximité

title: (7670) - N261-4
description: Shaded area, quiet and away from the road, offering a beautiful panorama or level parking will be chosen in front of the reservoir. The semi-stabilized access is rather reserved for vans and / or small motorhomes especially after the rain. No service, restaurant / bar with wifi at 600 meters as the crow flies.

title: (7800) Beringel - Unnamed Road
description: Small asphalt parking lot directly at a dam. Fishing and boating is not allowed here, but otherwise no other prohibition signs. I asked a dam worker who said it was OK to stay here overnight. I might not show up here in packs or do cuddle camping, but single overnight stays without camping behavior are fine.

title: (7780) Castro Verde - N123
description: Intermarché car park (no water or drain service) but self-service launderette and a bank withdrawal machine

name: Castro Verde Camping
title: (7780-200) Castro Verde Camping
description: Camping where everything is new and rather well thought out. Very good to stop in the Algarve or vice versa.

title: (7780) Castro Verde -
description: Large open area overlooking Castro Verde.

title: (7780-287) Castro Verde - 4 Rua Manuel da Fonseca
title_short: (7780-287) Castro Verde - 4 Rua Manuel da Fonseca
description: Nice place to stay.

title: (7780-120) Castro Verde - 12 Avenida de António Sérgio
title_short: (7780-120) Castro Verde - 12 Avenida de António Sérgio
description: Parking along the shaded pool road but daytime traffic see the night. Near the fire station !!

name: Adega dos Nascedios
title: (7630) Adega dos Nascedios
description:
A place to Park inside the private property surrounded by a winery, vineyards where its possible to walk and explore, next to the owners house.
Acess by a good road of a small Village called Fornalhas Novas. 
Wine Shop inside. 
A possibility of winetasting plus local products, with visit to the winery (previous booking)

name: Parque Campismo - Barragem Monte da Rocha
title: (7670) Parque Campismo - Barragem Monte da Rocha
title_short: (7670) Parque Campismo - Barragem Monte da Rocha
description:
Very, very quiet place. Great attention. Plenty of space for motorhomes, with electricity for all, emptying and filling services.
Clean and practical toilets and showers. Good option to stop from the north towards the Algarve and rest well after a dip in the pool.

title: (7780-277) Castro Verde - 9 Largo da Feira
description: Huge nice place to park next to the windmill. Nice walk into town & Coviran supermarket just opposite...The picturesque windmill is located at the far end. The old fella got it going from 8pm to 11pm. Showed us the workings. This parking is used for fiestas, concerts & alike so always check before you go there. Also access to free wifi

title: (7570) Minas do Lousal -
description: Big flat Parking unused. Seems to be for visitors of the museum or for train station. 100 meter bumpy road shortly before.

title: (7670) - Unnamed Road
description: Behind a small village where you can buy sheep cheese, an easily accessible and flat space with a view of the lake. Quiet.

title: (7670) Garvão -
description:
Nestled in the heart of Portugal's beautiful countryside of Alentejo, our caravan host location offers a truly breathtaking experience. As the sun begins to set, the sky is transformed into a canvas of vibrant oranges, pinks, and purples and as night falls, you'll be treated to the magic of dark, starry skies that seem to stretch on forever.


At our caravan pitches the views from our site are truly panoramic, with vast horizons stretching out as far as the eye can see. The beautiful landscape is dotted with cork oaks, holms oaks, and other native trees, providing a tranquil and serene setting for your stay. That is why the distance between each pitch ensures that you have plenty of room to spread out and enjoy the beautiful views and nature that surrounds you
Nature lovers will be in their element here, as the area is alive with the sounds of birds and sheep grazing in the fields. The silence of nature is a constant companion, creating a sense of calm and relaxation that is hard to find in the hustle and bustle of city life.
Despite its isolated location, our site is conveniently located just a short distance from the local village, where you will find a range of amenities. If you're looking to explore further afield, the sea coast is just a 40-minute drive away, while the Algarve can be reached within an hour and Lisbon within two hours.
 Whether you need help, enjoy a delicious meal, or simply want to chat with friendly locals, our house is just a short walking distance away.
Please contact before visiting. Always by e-mail or Whatsup.

title: (7780) Castro Verde - Rua da Corredoura
description: Emptying and filling area for gray and black water, in the brand new Internarche supermarket it has a motorhome wash area (lots of height). There are also machines for washing clothes, there is plenty of parking, but I don't know if overnight stays are allowed.

title: (7780-201) Castro Verde - 27 Rua Nova da Feira
title_short: (7780-201) Castro Verde - 27 Rua Nova da Feira
description:
Parking and service area in the LIDL car park.
Parking is free for 24 hours and has 6 spaces.
The water and emptying services are also free, but you must request the activation of the water at checkout n°1 in the store.

title: (7570) Minas do Lousal - 210 Rua 25 Abril
description:
The gate is open. A quiet, safe place in a small village. Choice of sun & shade spots. The facilities are in good order and clean. Every pitch has electricity. The drinking water does not have a connection for a garden hose. Behind the building is another water point, it might be easier there if you want to fill large amounts of water.

If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs against the barking of the (stray) dogs. Occasionally they make a lot of noise, but not continuously.

The mining museum is nice to visit, even when it is closed you can walk through it and read the information boards.

You can also walk to the river. I saw a camper here, but I don't know if spending the night there is allowed.

I have not seen any police, GNR or any form of control in 3 days. But the village is so small that the locals keep an eye on it themselves, I think.

title: (7570) Setúbal - Unnamed Road
description: Nice place near the lake, not crowded at all. The abandoned water pumping station to protect from the rain is near. Very tasty toast and grapes in the cafe near the old steam locomotive produced in Paris in 1891 :) new motorhome parking.

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado -
description: Directly at the reservoir only for vans. With larger motorhomes it is possible but difficult. The road is very washed out with lots of potholes. There is only a turning point at the end of the path. If in doubt, walk down the path to see if you can get through.

title: (7670) Funcheira - Rua do Poço Novo 11
description: Beautiful site in Alentejo with olive trees, hazelnuts, romancer, figes, cypres, loquats, a big ash tree, etc. close to the train station that connects Algarve to Porto. 40km to the beach (Vila Nova de Milfontes, Porto Covo, Praia do Malhão), 8km to a dam (Monte da Rocha). 3 min walk from public toilets and a restaurant. 15min walk to the nearest village (Garvão). Please contact before visiting. Always by e-mail or Whatsup.

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado - Estr. Nacional 262
description: Small parking lot at the cemetery. perfect for spending the day on the way between the Algarve and Lisbon without detour.

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado -
description: Alternative to the motorhome area if nature is needed. quiet corner next to a wood. lake 5 min walk. we stayed 2 nights with no problem.

title: (7670) - Unnamed Road
description: Full of spot at the edge of the water, just follow the path! Passage 10T ok, only in the world!

title: (7800-522) Beja - BP Rua António Sardinha
description: LPG filling station with NL/UK filling nipple can be borrowed in the store.

title: (7670) - Unnamed Road
description: Very nice spot in the plain, where it was before a lake. The lake is now very low but you can still 30min to see water. Really quite place near a well, we met a farmer coming to feed his water tank, no problem to stay overnight. No services, nice spot to preserve, many wildlife: rabbits and lots of birds.

title: (7800-309) Beja - Rua 1º de Maio
description: Parking park merendas, flat environment friendly, sports course for the brave. Water point at 100 m at the sanitary block of the picnic area. Passage of the police in the evening and in the morning, no problem. Another parking 500 m before the stadiums. Lots of traffic down the road but reasonable at night.

title: (7900-360) Odivelas - 5 N2
description: Just a place to spend the night of you need a free spot around here. It's next to a hotel, it's safe and not alot of noise.

title: (7800) Beja - 8 Rua Zeca Afonso
description: Continental parking with laundry

title: (7800-326) Beja - 1 Rua Natalia Correia
description: Far away from the IP2 and the avenue of the cemetery this one does not present noise problems like the 3 others around. You have the lake and the little cafe restaurant next door and in the center for relaxation with bike path and pedestrian. No services but the toilets of the park merenda are close with the possibility of refueling water with standard screw tap.

title: (7800-309) Beja - 30 Avenida Comandante Ramiro Correia
description: Roadside parking

title: () Beja - Rua D2, proximo da rua nº 02050090
title_short: () Beja - Rua D2, proximo da rua nº 02050090
description: Parking tolerated day and night, except heavy goods vehicles. No service. Fairly quiet. Close to shops and the city center. Perfect for visiting and stopping 24h.

address.street: Rua D2, proximo da rua nº 02050090

title: (7800-282) Beja - 61 Rua Conselheiro Meneses
description: Parking in a residential area. Five minutes walk from the Castle and the historic center. Only for Camper vans.

name: Parque de Campismo Municipal Beja
title: (7800-029) Parque de Campismo Municipal Beja
description: In town, cheap, but no charm, wedged between walls and buildings, no location, sandy and jolky ground and many noisy travel people. To sleep avoid the spring festival around April 25, just behind the campsite: din all night.

title: (7800-296) Beja - 19 Rua de Santo Andre
description: Dirt car park in the plaça de touros (arena) near the town center, just next to the castle visit.

title: (7800) Beja - 52 Rua de São Sebastião
description: Facing the arenes, free, very close to the castle

title: (7800-264) Beja - 1 Largo de São Tiago
description: Parking at the top of the village, next to the castle, free, central and quiet without services

title: (7670-503) Santa Luzia - 3A Rua dos Marmeleiros
description: public toilet

title: (7670) Ourique - 24 Cm 1131
description: Small parking space that can accommodate 2 motorhomes. The place is quiet. Very little traffic, the village is barely 500m away.

title: () Odivelas - Unnamed Road
description: At the edge of the dam, site with bar snack, beach, children playground, outdoor barbecues, picnic, beach NET tables free volleyball, wc and showers.  Possibility to spend the night in the driveway above the site, but not inside the site because camping 1 km, peaceful place with amenities.

title: (7670-282) Ourique - 19 Rua Dom Manuel
description: Around the Castello there's a miradouro and enough place to park your camper. It's a bit of a steep road to climb but okay. There's fresh water, cute benches to have a picnic and some playground attributes (a swing and a slide). The toilet is very clean, there's toilet paper and water and soap to wash your hands. The town of Ourique is very cute with white houses with coloured frames and an abundance of orange trees.

title: (7670-281) Ourique - 32 Rua D Afonso Hanriques D Conquistador de Ourique
title_short: (7670-281) Ourique - 32 Rua D Afonso Hanriques D Conquistador de Ourique
description: Behind the town hall of Ourique, two almost flat car parks. One in asphalt, the other in dirt. Public toilets accessible directly between the two car parks, pleasant garden of the church just above and unobstructed panorama of the surroundings. We stopped for just a few hours .

address.street: 32 Rua D Afonso Hanriques D Conquistador de Ourique

title: (7920) Alvito - Unnamed Road
description: Located on the at the ‘barragem de olivedas’ lake, between the picnic spot (with a very nice bar/restaurant) and the camping. The picnic spot (5 min walk) has toilets & showers and drinking water. Picnic spot itself gets checked by GNR quite regularly but camping a bit further out/behind it, leaves you a beautiful spot next to the lake with services close by.

name: Camping Markadia
title: (7920-999) Camping Markadia
description: Campsite Markádia. The campsite is open all year round. It is located at the Odivelas reservoir, on a 25 acre peninsula. Best campsite we have been, huge lake to do activities: windsurf, Paddel, canoe, tenis, absolut Nature. Perfect layover between Algarve and Lisbon, it's a piece of heaven on earth. Everything very clean, Washrooms... 2 Restaurants with view to the lake. Pool, tenis, kids area.

title: (7670-291) Ourique - 2 Azinhaga do Zé Virgínia
description: Good view, shadows, 4 places

title: (7670) Ourique - N123
description: 2 washing machines, one for 18 kg and one for 8 kg of clothing and a dryer for 18 kg of clothing. Next to it is a supermarket, a pharmacy and a pizzeria so you can eat or shop while washing. You need coins to pay.

title: (7670) Ourique - N123
description: Good parking space, nearby wc's, restaurants, farmacy, coffees, playground. Banks, health care unit in the surroundings.

title: (7900) Odivelas - Unnamed Road
description: Square in the countryside next to the dam. Near a charming Alentejo village. Nice view, very quiet place. Swimming possible. No convenience. Be careful not to drive into the sand. Bar Snack 800 meters to have a drink!

title: (7800) Beja - 7800 Estrada das Apolinarias
description: Laundry unit self service next to Continente supermarkt and shops.

title: (7570) Grândola -
description: Simple stopping point on the old disused national road. Almost no noise, except those of the few trains passing from time to time in the distance.

title: (7900) Odivelas - N257
description: Peaceful place with an unobstructed view of the wild lake. In this place, you feel like you're alone in the world

name: Green Oaks Alentejo
title: (7670-215) Green Oaks Alentejo
description:
We are a family of six and offer quietly located accommodation in a small river valley on our property.
Here you are surrounded by wild nature and have a phenomenal view of the night sky.
The pitches have direct access to the swimming area at the reservoir. A solar shower, a composting toilet and running water are freely available.
On the farm, which is about 500 m away, there are sheep, goats, chickens and a lovely friendly dog.
You can arrive with a mobile home, caravan or tent.
Our pitches are located about 10 minutes from Ourique and the IC1, or 15 minutes from the motorway.
Please let us know before you come, we will then meet on site.

title: (7540) - 4 Largo 25 de Abril
description: Stopped here for a night in a parking place. Luckily we found here a water fountain and very clean free public toilets. The toilets are near the atm.

title: (7630) Colos - 2 N389
description: In a small village, parking space in the center, but a container, drinking water tap, washing bike and toilet.

title: (7630) Colos -
description: Nice place next to the road (not busy at all), nothing much around, but nature. good place to spend a night

title: (7670) Casas Velhas -
description: Quiet, natural pitch on dam. The right place to enjoy nature, listen to the birds and admire the spectacular starry sky.

title: (7670) - Unnamed Road
description:
Calme, natural Place with animals. Dogs on the leash. Nice view in the Alentejo. 
Please contact us

name: Camping Corgo do Pardieiro
title: (7630) Camping Corgo do Pardieiro
description:
Treasure of nature
Amoreiras gare
7630-514
(Gravel Road)

Under the enormous stars and hidden among the hills of South west Portugal you can find  our ‘ Treasure of Nature ‘. A 8.5-hectare nature park which invites you to be with yourself in nature. A place where you can make endless walks, visit the beautiful beaches, get quiet by the wide views, read a good book in one of the hammocks or … just do absolutely nothing!

title: (7670) - IC1
description: Restaurant Boa Viagem with huge parking lot which accepts motorhomes, the manager is very welcoming when she agrees to set up a table outside for our little doggie (great little attention) very well eaten despite it being a brasserie to recommend for a meal break and one night!

title: (7630-536) São Martinho das Amoreiras - Rua do Bairro Social/Rua Vale de Brique
title_short: (7630-536) São Martinho das Amoreiras - Rua do Bairro Social/Rua Vale de Brique
description: Parking lot with public toilets and water point.

address.street: Rua do Bairro Social/Rua Vale de Brique

title: (7940-148) Cuba - 4 Rua do Norte
description: If you want to discover the small village of Cuba, the ideal location because not advisable to enter the small streets. Tourist Office not far and at the foot of a small park and municipal pools.

title: (7630-521) Odemira - Ameixeira, EM 503
description: Very quiet, idyllic place with donkeys and chickens, surrounded by rolling hills and forests, in the heart of the Alentejo. Families with children are welcome. In the vicinity there are various possibilities for leisure activities such as hiking, swimming (lake within walking distance), bike tours, motocross and more. Shower, water toilet and WiFi are available. Prior registration by telephone required.

title: (7630-174) Beja - M532
description: Public washing machine with dryer. Enclosed public toilets with integrated showers (cold water). Right next door an ATM (Multibanco).

name: Monte Maravilhas
title: (7630) Monte Maravilhas
description: Simple beautiful campsite located in a valley. You come here for your rest. Lovely swimming pool filled with spring water. Nice loungers around it. Beautiful walking and cycling area. Nice village oo walking distance. Clean and simple sanitary facilities.

title: (7630) São Martinho das Amoreiras -
description:
Attention emplacement ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Quel dommage de ne l'avoir trouvé "que" pour le dej' et la sieste !
Vue à 360, moulin aux alentours et tranquillité absolue. Ici, dans cette partie du pays un peu aride, la nature est splendide.

⚠️ la piste d'accès est bien carrossable mais réservé à petit van (pas besoin de 4x4 mais camping  car impossible). Il fait faire preuve d'une attention particulière sur 20 m (petites ornières et cailloux moins petits ?), mais ça passe bien.

title: (4970-500) Torrão -
description: Nice and quiet place right behind the damm. No services at all but flat and with shade. Way to the water is steep but possible. You can walk with your dog for hours without meeting anyone.

title: (7540) - N121
description:
Motorhome/caravan overnight parking, private, fenced with controlled access (entry and exit) by video images for user safety. Provides non-drinking water. Price to be charged per vehicle only regardless of the number of occupants or pets. Time limit for entry to the park 11pm for total rest for those who are there.
Park in a natural environment where all the electrical energy used is of solar origin limiting its use. we have only one SOS point made available for life support purposes

title: (7595) Torrão - N5
description: Very quiet, panoramic view of the dam. Version 1 right before the bridge, 2 to 3 camping car with air. Before the bridge to the left 1, and after the bridge to doubt 2 see 3. Be careful left after the bridge c forbidden. Property of the state. Narrow road for the PL

name: Monte Huam Hu
title: (7630-536) Monte Huam Hu
description:
Picture yourself waking up to the crisp morning air, surrounded by lush greenery that stretches as far as the eye can see. You step outside your camper van and take in the breathtaking view of the valley below - a sight so magnificent, it seems as though it's straight out of a postcard.

Welcome to Monte Huam Hu, a camping site that offers not just a place to park your camper van, but an experience that will leave you in awe. The site may be simple, but it has everything you need to make your stay comfortable. From water (limited) to electricity and access to WI-FI just a few steps away, you won't have to worry about anything else but immersing yourself in the beauty that surrounds you.

Take a stroll around the valley and explore the nearby hills. Find the perfect spot to lay in a hammock under the shade and take in the serenity that nature provides. With plenty of areas to hang out and relax, you'll never tire of the breathtaking views. There’s no air pollution at Monterey Huam Hu so the night sky is truly a breathtaking sight. 

Make Monte Huam Hu your home away from home and escape the hustle and bustle of daily life. This is where tranquility lives, and memories are made. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to discover one of nature's true wonders! 

The site does not offer a dump station. 

Please be kind to get in touch before visiting!

title: (7570) Grândola - A. do Sul
description: Rest area on A2 motorway. Standard parking, gas station and restaurant. Good to have a rest during the trip.

title: (7670-201) Ourique - Unnamed Road
description: Free water tap including threading

name: Camping Serro da Bica
title: () Camping Serro da Bica
description: Serro da Bica campsite! Small campsite located in nature, on the banks of the Mira River. Very spacious campsite, spacious pitches and good sanitary facilities with underfloor heating. Also ideal to spend the winter.

title: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo - Unnamed Road
title_short: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo - Unnamed Road
description: Very nice place in height with plenty of space and view of the lake (easy to access, free and far from houses)

title: (7555) Santiago do Cacém - Unnamed Road
description: Next to the dam, but flatter. Attention enter through the other end of the road in the right turn after the dam (on the side dam there is a big puddle where you could get bogged down). On weekends there must be people because there is a place to barbecue. When you arrive, turn in the grassy part to avoid going down because then very fine sand at the crossing.

title: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo -
description: Magnificent view of the lake. Really quiet in November, some fishermen and hikers. If you enter directly after the dam you can walk along the water (maybe not if the water is higher) but there are some really big puddles on the forest road. We are not trying to enter from the north. enjoy it and keep it clean :)

title: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo - Rua de Acacio Guerreiro de Melo
title_short: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo - Rua de Acacio Guerreiro de Melo
description: Opposite the other well-known spots - on the other side of the lake there is a place for a camper that can be easily reached with a little skill. Mine is 6M Land, Sprinter 209 - backwards down the aisle I was able to position myself perfectly with a lake view. There are more standing options slightly above this square, but there is some junk here and there. So a good opportunity to leave a little order. It's so quiet here, so few cars pass on the embankment during the day. Otherwise you are alone, in the distance the campers on the other side.

address.street: Rua de Acacio Guerreiro de Melo

title: (7920-031) Alvito - 13 Rua Alexandre Herculano
description: Alvito - Large flat parking - Bins and picnic tables

title: (7920-060) Alvito - 11 Rua da Tapadinha Dom António
title_short: (7920-060) Alvito - 11 Rua da Tapadinha Dom António
description: Free park on the edge of town.

title: (7555) Corgos -
description: On the banks of a dam that dried up at this time. On the edge of a eucalyptus forest. Total calm, only the noise bed insects. Easy access by following the track.

title: (7555) Corgos - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful spot, sheltered from the (s-w) wind. Reachable via gravel road from the dam, around the lake (anti clockwise). Tracks are 4x4 only, since there are some steep muddy climbs to tackle. Surrounded by only nature, didn’t see anyone. No network.

title: (7595-125) Torrão - 38 Rua João Chagas
description: Convenient to park the time of the rzndo and the visit but not very pretty and dusty

title: (7555) Vale de Água -
description: Regenerative farm in a beautiful piece of land. Close to Cercal and 15 minutes away from the coast line. With a new native forest growing with water, solar shower available and compost dry toilet. Very calm place perfect to reconnect with nature. Easy dust road access. The owners live next door and will be very happy to welcome you.

title: (7595) Torrão - Rua de Santa Maria
description: Beautiful place, close to the water and with a view for the "Montado" (hill with oak trees). Perfect to spend the night and some time.

title: (7570) Santa Margarida da Serra - Unnamed Road
title_short: (7570) Santa Margarida da Serra - Unnamed Road
description:
This idyllic and quiet place is surrounded by nature. Sheep, chickens, vegetable garden and a breathtaking view of the clear starry sky.

Access is via gravel roads.

One night against donation. Longer stays with the opportunity to help out in the vegetable garden, with the animals, with construction, etc. are possible by arrangement.

Love Alex

PS: Garden with fresh vegetables is available.

title: () Torrão -
description:
This is a Quinta directly at the lake owned by a family. Warm shower, toilets and a chill area directly at the lake. Enjoy pure nature and observe the wildlife around the lake.
You can come with your caravan or tent. €12.- per van/tent. €3 per extra person/pet.
Contact them before you arrive and make sure they are around.

title: (7670-201) Baixo Alentejo - M503
description: Quiet spacious parking lot at bridge. request not to put a toilet or leave rubbish. it's clean and nice here. and very quiet. there aren't many places around so let's be sparing with what's there.

title: (7595) Torrão - N2
description: Small corner for picnic. Does not know if possible to stay the night. But I think so.

title: (7595) Torrão - N2
description: Pleasant place to spend the night. Near the village, earth access but in good condition, on the edge of an old quarry and near the river.

title: (7700-999) Aldeia dos Fernandes - E1
description: Motorway rest stop with supply and disposal

title: (7700) Almodôvar - A do Sul
description: Service station with petrol station and loading and unloading of gray and black water.

title: (7920-351) Vila Nova da Baronia - 7 Avenida 1º de Maio
title_short: (7920-351) Vila Nova da Baronia - 7 Avenida 1º de Maio
description: Vila Nova da Baronia - simpatic village, just a regular parking,is not a camping area, a great restaurant near 300 meters with tradicional Alentejo food - Restaurant  "O Camões".

title: (7570) Grândola - Unnamed Road
description: Nice square with several tables and benches in picturesque Alentejo village.

title: (7570) Grândola -
description: Water source

title: (7960) Vila de Frades - N258
description: The day I came here, it was closed. I went to visit Vila de Frades and Vidigueira. The Museum of the ruins in V Frades was closed, the ethnographic in Vidigueira was open. The cuisine is very good based on large white bread, goat cheese, tomatoes, asparagus, aromatic herbs from the countryside, good sausages and red meat steaks. The space has no support but is very quiet and clean, since it only serves the ruins. A nearby farm has a pack of dogs that barked all night. Ruïnes closed on Mondays and Tuesday mornings.

title: (7570) Grândola - 45 Rua Maria Espada Feio Beatriz
title_short: (7570) Grândola - 45 Rua Maria Espada Feio Beatriz
description:
Picnic tables and barbecue available, next to a tiny stream.
Workout equipment present. Fig tree.
The municipality is working on installing toilets to turn the area into an eco spot. It is legal to park here overnight.
Good for a snack stop but close to the road, noisy to spend the night.

title: (7570-239) Grândola - 12 Avenida António Inácio da Cruz
title_short: (7570-239) Grândola - 12 Avenida António Inácio da Cruz
description: Parking on the streets next to the park. Public toilets open from 08:00-20:00 in the park close to the fountain. Slept one night felt safe. Police passed several times without saying anything. But we kept our door shut to not disturb anyone.

title: (7665) Luzianes - Vale Cernes
description:
Please call first ! or WhatsApp.

We are a family with 2 children aged 8 and 6 and emigrated to Portugal in May 2022.

We renovate our ruin with clay. and currently live in our trailer.

Away from the house there is a wonderful place in nature to stand and linger.
Enjoy the silence !

Are you interested in clay building, life in Portugal? Do you want to emigrate yourself, possibly with children, and have questions about emigration, buying a house, bureaucracy, etc.?
If there is time, we would be happy to share our experiences with you.

Simply ask for an overnight stay to exchange experiences.
 
In the village of Luzianes there is a small shop for basics (drinks, bread, biscuits etc.) There is a public shower that you can use.

The Santa Clara reservoir is super nice for swimming and hiking, it is about 15 minutes away by car.
in Santa Clara there is a gas station, two supermarkets, a café and a post office.

Everyone passing through with a self-sufficient car is welcome, also for longer periods, by arrangement. Animals welcome :) , but the site is not fenced.
At the moment there is no water and no electricity on the pitch.

We have a washing machine that can be used for a fee of 10 euros.

If you have any questions, just let us know ❤️

title: (7570-177) Grândola - 18 Rua Doutor Jacinto Nunes
description: Self-service laundromat with three washing and drying machines each, change machine, television, seating, WiFi and sockets. Open 2a a domingo 07:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m. Parking is possible at the park around the corner. Another salon one street further.

title: (7960) Vidigueira - 26 N258
description: Very large parking area close to town but set well back off the road so no road noise. Flat easy access for 20+ vehicles of any size. We were alone but it was November. Very peaceful.

name: Monte Cruz
title: (7665) Monte Cruz
description:
We offer a pitch with water & electricity and the magnificent view of the rolling hills of the Alentejo and the lake of Monte Cruz.

A natural paradise is being created on 4.5 hectares of land, which is filled with a lot
dedication to saving our precious commodity water and reforestation.

If you are interested in learning more about the project, life in Portugal and the cycles of nature, then you are welcome to combine your stay with a Monte Tour. The access to the property includes a dirt road of about 800 m. In addition, 2 dogs and 10 chickens live on the Monte.

Further services:

Monte Tour 3-4 h with snacks and drinks

Vegetable basket/jam
eggs
Massage 30mins/60mins/90mins
            
Please call before arrival or contact us via Whatsapp by phone or email

If you have any questions, please write a short message

title: (7700) Almodôvar - N2
description: New motorhome Area, next to route N2. Excellent 17 Fully serviced pitches each having own electric, water and grey waste. New drive over service point and chemical toilet sluice. All very clean. Entry by automated website card payment and QR code scanner. Highly recommended.

title: (7540-551) - 30 Rua Da Eira
description: Small space without service for a break or a night on the road from Lisbon to Faro

title: (7700) Almodôvar - Unnamed Road
description: At the foot of the small chapel with a 360 ° view of the surroundings from the highest point. Very quiet place without services and attention narrow road not recommended for motorhomes, preferable for vans and vans.

title: (7570) Grândola - Parque de Grândola
description: Free Parking, Facilities in Sport complex.

title: (7570) Grândola - 12A Rua Dr.José Pereira Barradas
description: Small square clay near quiet subdivision 3 places about no service but quiet for one night

title: (7570) Grândola - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful place  near a small chapel in the middle of Kirkeichen. Gorgeous view, absolutely quiet

title: (7570-175) Grândola - 2 Rua 1 de Maio
description: Located on the country road and a little louder. Motorhomes are not prohibited. Trash can tables and benches permanently installed. Lidl next door.

title: (7940) Vila Alva -
description: Place at the edge of the gravel road. A possible level place. Nice view of the lake and ?. Please keep clean. Also for motorhome up to 7m. Absolutely calm.

title: (7570-125) Grândola -
description: No estacionamento do hipermercado modelo continente tem 4 lugares reservados a autocaravanas

title: (7940) Vila Alva - Unnamed Road
description: Discreet place, possibility of sleeping by the water. Seen on the lake. No services Just no shade because no trees.

title: (7940) Vila Alva - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful spot in the countryside, facing the lake. Possibility of nice walks. No service.

title: (7940) Vila Alva - Unnamed Road
description: Nice place in the middle of nature. Nice clear water. Good for swimming. Suitable for small vans, 4x4, silent. Also suitable for overnight stays. No further facilities, so bring garbage ?!

title: (7700) Almodôvar - 103 Rua João de Gusmão

description: It is a BP gas station Free water supply Rest area with tables and shade Very clean gas station toilets, water and bidet. Do not plug in the toilets.

title: (7670) Santa Pequena -
description: A quiet dirt road close to the IC1. several flat spots available next to the road. a German lady stopped this morning to tell me there is a nicer spot about 500m further down the road across from her house.

title: (7090-231) Viana do Alentejo - Estrada Dona Ana 1
title_short: (7090-231) Viana do Alentejo - Estrada Dona Ana 1
description: Services area on parking of the Municipal Park and the sports complex. Parking possible. Calm. Pool nearby. Nice village to visit with a castle.

title: (7090) Viana do Alentejo - Unnamed Road
description: Nice parking lot with a picnic area in front of the beautifully renovated church of Nossa Senhora dos Aires.

title: (7750) Castro Verde - Rua de São Miguel
title_short: (7750) Castro Verde - Rua de São Miguel
description: Idyllic picnic area with tables, benches and 2 grills. A trash can available. Now a lot of water in the river in February.

title: (7220) Santana - Unnamed Road
description: Lugar relativamente plano entre prados alentejanos com animais (vacas e cavalos) e o rio numa antiga barragem. optimo para relaxar a ouvir a natureza a sombra de oliveiras

title: (7220) - Travessa da Cancela
description: Just see with your own eyes :)to avoid the village first round about on entering village take first right go down to lake turn left on road dirt track keep lake on right for about half a mile turn left and then right  (straight on) up road to next right go down past cemetery and your there it amazing

title: (7750) Gatao - Unnamed Road
description: Esplanade at a crossroads of two tracks, not very flat, the place is very quiet and the view is beautiful. On the RB30 track.

title: (7090-064) Alcáçovas - 40 Rua da Bela Vista

Free street parking above the beautiful municipal pool.
Lovely view. Very friendly town. visit the cow bell factory next to the cemetary.
